StringSupport

Logic for interacting with and manipulating strings

Functions
Concat
call StringSupport.Concat(
first,
second,
&result
);

Combines two strings into a single string

Parameters
first

The first string

second

The second string

Response Parameters
&result

the combined string

Example
local result;
call StringSupport.Concat("foo", "bar", &result);
//result == "foobar"
FormatNumber
call StringSupport.FormatNumber(
messageStringIndex,
arg1,
&result
);

Supports formatting a number as, or into, a string

Parameters
messageStringIndex

The pattern string

arg1

the number to format

Response Parameters
&result

the formatted string

Example
local result;
local number = 100;
call StringSupport.FormatNumber("The number is {0}", number, &result);
//result == "The number is 100"
FormatNumber2
call StringSupport.FormatNumber2(
messageStringIndex,
arg1,
arg2,
&result
);

Supports formatting 2 numbers into a string

Parameters
messageStringIndex

The pattern string

arg1

the 1st number to format, corresponding with pattern {0}

arg2

the 2nd number to format, corresponding with pattern {1}

Response Parameters
&result

the formatted string

Example
local result;
local number = 100;
call StringSupport.FormatNumber("The number is {0}+{1}", number, number, &result);
//result == "The number is 100+100"
FormatNumber3
call StringSupport.FormatNumber3(
messageStringIndex,
arg1,
arg2,
arg3,
&result
);

Supports formatting 3 numbers into a string

Parameters
messageStringIndex

The pattern string

arg1

the 1st number to format, corresponding with pattern {0}

arg2

the 2nd number to format, corresponding with pattern {1}

arg3

the 3rd number to format, corresponding with pattern {2}

Response Parameters
&result

the formatted string

FormatNumber4
call StringSupport.FormatNumber4(
messageStringIndex,
arg1,
arg2,
arg3,
arg4,
&result
);

Supports formatting 4 numbers into a string

Parameters
messageStringIndex

The pattern string

arg1

the 1st number to format, corresponding with pattern {0}

arg2

the 2nd number to format, corresponding with pattern {1}

arg3

the 3rd number to format, corresponding with pattern {2}

arg4

the 4th number to format, corresponding with pattern {3}

Response Parameters
&result

the formatted string

FormatNumber5
call StringSupport.FormatNumber5(
messageStringIndex,
arg1,
arg2,
arg3,
arg4,
arg5,
&result
);

Supports formatting 5 numbers into a string

Parameters
messageStringIndex

The pattern string

arg1

the 1st number to format, corresponding with pattern {0}

arg2

the 2nd number to format, corresponding with pattern {1}

arg3

the 3rd number to format, corresponding with pattern {2}

arg4

the 4th number to format, corresponding with pattern {3}

arg5

the 5th number to format, corresponding with pattern {4}

Response Parameters
&result

the formatted string

Format
call StringSupport.Format(
message,
arg1,
&result
);

Creates a new string by filling in a single placeholder value

Parameters
message

the string with a single format argument

arg1

the item to insert into the string

Response Parameters
&result

the string created by formatting the message

Example
local result;
call StringSupport.Format("The current part is part #{0}", "5", &result);
//result = "The current part is part #5"
Format2
call StringSupport.Format2(
message,
arg1,
arg2,
&result
);

Creates a new string by filling in two placeholder values

Parameters
message

the string with two format arguments

arg1

the first format argument

arg2

the second format argument

Response Parameters
&result

the string created by formatting the message

Example
call StringSupport.Format2("The current part is {0}{1}", "part #", "5", &result); //result = "The current part is part #5"
Format3
call StringSupport.Format3(
message,
arg1,
arg2,
arg3,
&result
);

Creates a new string by filling in three placeholder values

Parameters
message

the string with three format arguments

arg1

the first format argument

arg2

the second format argument

arg3

the third format argument

Response Parameters
&result

the string created by formatting the message

Example
call StringSupport.Format3("The {0} part is {1}{2}", "current", "part #", "5", &result); //result = "The current part is part #5"
Format4
call StringSupport.Format4(
message,
arg1,
arg2,
arg3,
arg4,
&result
);

Creates a new string by filling in four placeholder values

Parameters
message

the string with four format arguments

arg1

the first format argument

arg2

the second format argument

arg3

the third format argument

arg4

the fourth format argument

Response Parameters
&result

the string created by formatting the message

Example
call StringSupport.Format4("The {0} part is {1}{2}. Parts until completion: {3}", "current", "part #", "5", "10", &result); //result = "The current part is part #5. Parts until completion: 10"
Format5
call StringSupport.Format5(
message,
arg1,
arg2,
arg3,
arg4,
arg5,
&result
);

Creates a new string by filling in five placeholder values

Parameters
message

the string with four format arguments

arg1

the first format argument

arg2

the second format argument

arg3

the third format argument

arg4

the fourth format argument

arg5

the fifth format argument

Response Parameters
&result

the string created by formatting the message

Example
call StringSupport.Format5("The {0} part is {1}{2}. Parts {3}: {4}", "current", "part #", "5", "until completion", "10", &result); //result = "The current part is part #5. Parts until completion: 10"
